intro: Cladopus fallax, commonly known as the slender false heather, is a perennial shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acidophilous plants. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. Its leaves are small, elliptical, and have a leathery texture. Cladopus fallax produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in late spring to early summer.
